title: How to Make Salmon Chutney

steps.headline: Add 1/4 cup of vegetable oil into the frying pan.
steps.description: Turn the heat level on the stove to medium. Once you have allowed the vegetable oil to heat, carefully place the salmon fillet into the frying pan.

steps.headline: Season the salmon with a ⁄4 tablespoon (3.7 ml) of turmeric and a ⁄4 tablespoon (3.7 ml) of salt.
steps.description: Spread it evenly onto the salmon fillet.

steps.headline: Fry the salmon fillet.
steps.description: Fry for about 3 minutes on one side and flip it over on to the other side afterward. Continue frying it for about 1-2 minutes.

steps.headline: Chop an onion if you haven't already.
steps.description: Peel 1 onion and place it on the cutting board. Chop the onion using a kitchen knife and use about 1/2 a cup of chopped onion.

steps.headline: Chop cilantro (as much preferred) on to the cutting board.
steps.description: Place on top of the chopped onions.

steps.headline: Measure out a ⁄4 tablespoon (3.7 ml) of salt.
steps.description: Add it onto the chopped onions and cilantro.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients using a spoon or a clean hand.
steps.description: Mix the onions, cilantro, and salt together until fully mixed.

steps.headline: Chop 3-4 Serrano peppers using a kitchen knife on the cutting board.
steps.description: Place onto the mixing bowl of onions, cilantro, and salt, and then mix the chopped peppers in.

steps.headline: Add the fried salmon fillet.
steps.description: Put it into the mixture of onions, cilantro, salt, and peppers, and stir in the salmon until it is a soft, smashed mixture of the veggies and salmon mixed together.

steps.headline: Add a 1/2 tablespoon of mustard oil on to the salmon chutney.
Mix the mustard oil in.
steps.description: Your salmon chutney is ready to be served.

text: Add 1/4 cup of vegetable oil into the frying pan. Turn the heat level on the stove to medium. Once you have allowed the vegetable oil to heat, carefully place the salmon fillet into the frying pan. Season the salmon with a ⁄4 tablespoon (3.7 ml) of turmeric and a ⁄4 tablespoon (3.7 ml) of salt. Spread it evenly onto the salmon fillet. Fry the salmon fillet. Fry for about 3 minutes on one side and flip it over on to the other side afterward. Continue frying it for about 1-2 minutes. Chop an onion if you haven't already. Peel 1 onion and place it on the cutting board. Chop the onion using a kitchen knife and use about 1/2 a cup of chopped onion. Chop cilantro (as much preferred) on to the cutting board. Place on top of the chopped onions. Measure out a ⁄4 tablespoon (3.7 ml) of salt. Add it onto the chopped onions and cilantro. Mix the ingredients using a spoon or a clean hand. Mix the onions, cilantro, and salt together until fully mixed. Chop 3-4 Serrano peppers using a kitchen knife on the cutting board. Place onto the mixing bowl of onions, cilantro, and salt, and then mix the chopped peppers in. Add the fried salmon fillet. Put it into the mixture of onions, cilantro, salt, and peppers, and stir in the salmon until it is a soft, smashed mixture of the veggies and salmon mixed together. Add a 1/2 tablespoon of mustard oil on to the salmon chutney.  Mix the mustard oil in. Your salmon chutney is ready to be served.
